name: cheese briouates
ingredients: 1 piece of preserved lemon (cut into small cubes)
20 cl of olive oil (for the filling/cooking)
steps: Prepare the filling: Roughly chop the herbs (parsley, coriander, mint). Add the olive oil, the preserved lemon cut into small cubes, the cumin, and the ginger. Mix with the goat cheese.
Making the briouates: Cut each sheet of brick pastry into 3 strips of 5 cm width. Trim one end into a square and the other into a slant.
Lay out a strip of pastry. Place the filling near the edge, on the square end.
Fold into a triangle by alternately folding the corners (like a flag) until the strip is used up.
To seal, tuck the pointed end into a fold of the pastry.
Brown in a hot pan with a drizzle of olive oil (1 min on each side) or bake in the oven at 200 Â°C (4 min).
